Now as concerning those things which you hoped should be ordained by us for your bishops‚ we do without any delay and with readiness of mind make it our care to grant them, for the sake of the unfeignedness of your saith, of which we have been commendably informed in divers reports by the hearers of these our presents3 and we have sent two palls belonging to the two metro- politam, that is, for Honorius and Paulinus, in order that when one of them is called out of this world to the Author of his being, the other should appoint a bishop in his place by this our authority. And this thing truly we are moved to grant, as well for the good will of your love, as for the situation of such great provinces at the distance which is known to separate us from you, to the intent we might in all points shew our readiness to meet your devotion and act according to your wishes.
